DataElement.preferredName: Treatment Subsequent Therapy Intervention or Procedure Second Course Treatment  Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date of initiation of second-course treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment Subsequent Therapy Intervention or Procedure Second Course

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.:Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredName: Second Treatment Intervention or Procedure Date

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Second Therapy Intervention or Procedure Date

This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
